description.en: The basic concepts of money and banking are delivered. Practical exercises include the concept of time value of money, loan planning etc. During seminars essays are presented and discussed by the students
description.et: Loengutes käsitletakse olulisemaid raha- ja panganduse kontseptsioone. Praktikumides rakendatakse teoreetilisi kontseptsioone konkreetsete situatsioonide analüüsimisel. Seminaridel kuulatakse ja arutatakse referaate.

objectives.en:
Students will explore the main standpoints of different monetary theories about tasks, functions, quality and sorts of money and monetary systems; describe the goals of monetary policies,
methods and restrictions enacting them; describe expectations of the state, owners and clients of the banks; explore the structure, operation and technology  of the banks, also main banking services, the ability to use them and risks connected to the services.
objectives.et: Käsitleda rahateooriate põhiseisukohti raha ülesannete, kvaliteedi, raha liikide ja rahasüsteemide osas; rahapoliitika eesmärke ja meetodeid; kaasaegse panga tegevuse organiseerimist ja tehnoloogiaid; põhilisi pangateenuseid ja oskusi neid ise kasutada ja teisi nõustada.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing through the course the student has the knowledge about modern role of money and functioning principles of monetary and credit system, incl. idiomaticalness of Estonia. According to the theoretical concepts of monetary policy the student can evaluate purposeness and efficiency of instruments used in realised monetary policy. The student understands the role of the banks in the economy, has the overview of the financial basis of modern banking and services offered by financial institutions. The student has the ability to read financial statements of the banks and analyse different financial ratios (liquidity, risks, profitability etc); to use the main methods of management of financial risks; to compare and choose between basic services offered by banks, incl. credit schemes, cash and noncash instruments and channels, deposit products, forex and derivative trade; perform solvency analysis according theoretical concepts.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbimisel üliõpilane mõistab raha kaasaegset rolli ning raha- ja krediidisüsteemide ülesehituse ja toimimise eripärasid, sh. Eesti raha- ja pangasüsteemi eripärasid. Üliõpilane oskab hinnata rahapoliitikas kasutavate vahendite sihtotstarbekust ja tulemuslikkust rahapoliitilistele teoreetilistele kontseptsioonidele tuginedes. Üliõpilane mõistab pankade rolli majanduses, omab ülevaadet kaasaegse panga toimimise finants-majanduslikest alustest ja olulisematest pangateenustest. Üliõpilane omab oskuse lugeda panga finantsaruandlust ja analüüsida panga tegevust tulususe, usaldatavuse, likviidsuse ja võetud finantsriskide seisukohalt; kasutada peamisi finantsriskide juhtimise meetodeid; võrrelda ja valida panga poolt pakutavaid baasteenuseid, lähtudes nende põhimõttelistest eripäradest ning kasutaja  vajadustest, sh.: krediitfinantseerimisskeeme, sularahata makseinstrumente, -viise ja maksekanaleid, säästutooteid, valuuta- ja teisi tuletistehinguid; teostada kliendi krediidivõime analüüsi teoreetilistele seisukohtadele ja pangandustavadele tuginedes.

independent_work.et: Term paper. The student will have to write a term paper on selected topics in economic journals. The term paper will be graded as follows: Accuracy of the data: 20% of 100; -Style of writing, grammar and spelling: 15%; -Use of theories, models and concepts: 35%; -Relevance of the commentary: 30%.

description.et: Mid-term test (25% of final grade)- topics covered in lectures 1-4. Moodle.
Presentation of term paper (20% of  final grade). Each student or a group has to give a presentation in seminar (5-7 min). Moodle

grade_preconditions.et: Writing and presentation of the term paper, mid-term, and written exam

grade_evaluation.et: mid-term test 25%, presentation of term paper 20%, and written exam 55%.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
